featured.text: Only a few centimeters in length, the fish breed easily in captivity, grow quickly, and their transparent body makes it easy to study their organs.
In view of all these strengths, in the 1930s the United States and Canada undertook a research project in which they managed to breed an especially nutritious soybean with a high oil content.
B. Ben What gives humans the right to capture, confine, or breed other species?
In fact, it is nearly impossible to release captive-bred animals.

definition.zh_def: 品種；種類，通常指動植物的特定類型或品系。
definition.en_def: A type of animal or plant that has been developed by humans for specific characteristics.
definition.example: The farmer decided to breed chickens that lay larger eggs.
